pageContext.claim: “Would be sooo great if the Fed would further lower interest rates and quantitative ease. The Dollar is very strong against other currencies and there is almost no inflation. This is the time to do it. Exports would zoom!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is mixing up some basic economics. Quantitative easing is generally used during a recession when the economy needs the most support — not when the economy is strong, as Trump regularly boasts. The Fed last formally employed it during the 2009 recession. The Fed did, however, announce a plan in October 2019 to buy back more bonds but insists it is not QE. The New York Times reported this was, "a move meant to keep an obscure but critical corner of financial markets functioning smoothly."
